intro: Asarca cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf asarum, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Aristolochiaceae family, known for its unique and often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a distinct, somewhat hairy texture. The flowers are tubular and usually have a deep, intricate pattern that attracts specific pollinators.
